page.title: 15Home Life
page.content: About half the homes are farms or have farming connections, so life revolves around this industry. Wives and children help with poultry, calves, pigs, fruit, home decorating, maintenance, and accounts. Housework is easier with electric cleaners, washing machines, refrigerators, food mixers, and cookers. Telephones, television, cars and bikes are common- place. Many homes have fitted kitchens also bathrooms, solid fuel heaters and cookers, good country furniture and carpets. Most homes have pets, dogs and cats. Gardens are well stocked with flowers and vegetables.Children attend school out of the area and so go by bus after a breakfast of cereals and tea, having lunch or sandwiches there and returning for a cooked meal. Homework is usual, many children have music or dancing lessons.
